column8: I would be inclined to agree if Najib was at least transparent about the fuckup at 1MDB. But he chose to smokescreen the issue BY ANY MEANS for three years, marring the reputation of the country, seeking support from sketchy foreign governments, and sowing mistrust among segments of the population in the process. When he's booted out high-ranking figures from even his own party and cabinet for speaking out about the 1MDB, you know you have a truly self-serving, destructive man in the helm.One could vote for BN if they had picked a fresh new candidate (with no affiliation to Najib) to run for PM, but Najib is clearly manning the wheel, and there is no way a lot of good is coming out of continuity with Najib.
